snippet: The case involves a California man who sued Spokeo, a company that he said provided an error-filled profile of him to potential employers.
abstract: Supreme Court returns case to Ninth Circuit appeals court involving whether dissemination of false information on Internet is concrete injury; justices question appeals court ruling in favor of plaintiff Thomas Robins, who is suing data broker Spokeo over claims it provided error-filled profile of him to potential employers.
lead_paragraph: The case involves a California man who sued Spokeo, a company that he said provided an error-filled profile of him to potential employers.

headline.main: Supreme Court Returns False-Data Case to Appeals Panel
headline.print_headline: Case on Erroneous Data Goes Back to Lower Court for Additional Analysis
